newsitem.title: POLAND: POLISH NFI CALLS PROCHNIK SHARE TENDER.
newsitem.headline: POLISH NFI CALLS PROCHNIK SHARE TENDER.

text.p: Polish National Investment Fund (NFI) No 12 has announced a public tender offer to buy 343,501 garment maker Prochnik SA shares at 11 zlotys each to up its stake to 32.9 percent, a Warsaw bourse deputy president said.
PAP news agency on Tuesday quoted Ryszard Czerniawski as saying that investors would be able to sell the shares from February 27 to March 28.
"NFI Piast (No 12)...announced on February 25 a public tender offer for Prochnik SA...shares," Czerniawski said.
Currently NFI 12 has 9.9 percent or 149,999 Prochnik shares, which it bought in February.
The Warsaw Stock Exchange said in a separate statement it would suspend trade in Prochnik shares on Wednesday.
NFI 12 is one of the 15 NFIs in Poland's mass privatisation scheme in which the funds hold stakes in and manage about 500 companies.
Under Polish law, an investor seeking to buy a stake of at least 10 percent in a company in less than 90 days must announce a public tender offer for the shares it wants to buy.
Prochnik, which closed at 9.7 zlotys on the Warsaw bourse on Tuesday, has 1.5 million shares outstanding.
